meanings.definition: In a way that lacks romantic feelings or qualities.
meanings.sent1: She spoke unromantically about their relationship, focusing on practical aspects.
meanings.sent2: He unromantically proposed a joint bank account instead of a romantic getaway.
meanings.sent3: The movie portrayed love unromantically, with characters discussing budgets instead of candlelit dinners.
meanings.sent4: Her view of love was unromantically likened to a business transaction.
meanings.sent5: The novel described their love unromantically, comparing it to a spreadsheet rather than a love story.

meanings.definition: Without any romantic or sentimental elements.
meanings.sent1: Their unromantic dinner consisted of takeout and Netflix.
meanings.sent2: She preferred unromantic gifts like kitchen gadgets over flowers.
meanings.sent3: The unromantic gesture of fixing her leaky faucet won her heart.
meanings.sent4: His unromantic nature was evident in his practical approach to relationships.
meanings.sent5: The room had an unromantic atmosphere, with plain walls and fluorescent lighting.
